Package edu.harvard.cs262.DistributedGame

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Game
    Game is an interface that is implemented by every game so that it can interact with the client and server system.
    GameCommand
    A GameCommand is an interface that represents a command to be executed in a game.
    GameCommandProcessor
    GameCommandProcessor is an interface that represents the system by which commands are chosen to be run for a given game.
    GameDisplay
    The GameDisplay interface represents the display of each game that the client sees when they connect to the servers.
    GameInputParser
    The GameInputParser interface represents a mapping from input strings to GameCommand objects
    GameSnapshot
    The GameSnapshot interface represents the current snapshot of the game, which clients can render to display and view the current progression of the game.
    GameState
    The GameState interface represents the current state of the game, which is used by servers to execute commands on the game.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    GameRequestThread
    The GameRequestThread is a thread that asks the server every 250 ms for the newest snapshot.
